model_solution:
Step 1: Express both sides of the equation with the same base.
$\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = (16)^{2x+5} \Rightarrow \left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = (2^4)^{2x+5}$
Step 2: Apply the power rule to the right side of the equation.
$\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = (2^4)^{2x+5} \Rightarrow \left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = 2^{4(2x+5)}$
$\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = 2^{4(2x+5)} \Rightarrow \left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = 2^{8x+20}$
Step 3: Equate the exponents using the one-to-one property of exponents.
$\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = 2^{8x+20} \Rightarrow (2^{-2})^{2x+8} = 2^{8x+20}$
$\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = 2^{8x+20} \Rightarrow (2^{-2})^{2x+8} = 2^{8x+20} \Rightarrow 2^{-2(2x+8)}=2^{8x+20}$
Equate the exponents: $-2(2x+8)=8x+20$
$-4x-16=8x+20$
$-4x - 16 = 8x + 20 \Rightarrow -12x = 36$
$-12x = 36 \Rightarrow x = -3$
Divide both sides of the equation by -12: $\frac{-12x}{-12} = \frac{36}{-12}$
steps:
Step 1: Express both sides of the equation with the same base.
$\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = (16)^{2x+5} \Rightarrow \left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = (2^4)^{2x+5}$

Step 2: Apply the power rule to the right side of the equation.
$\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = (2^4)^{2x+5} \Rightarrow \left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = 2^{4(2x+5)}$

Step 3: Equate the exponents using the one-to-one property of exponents.
$\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = 2^{8x+20} \Rightarrow (2^{-2})^{2x+8} = 2^{8x+20}$
Divide both sides of the equation by -12: $\frac{-12x}{-12} = \frac{36}{-12}$
full_steps:
Step 1: Express both sides of the equation with the same base.
$\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = (16)^{2x+5} \Rightarrow \left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = (2^4)^{2x+5}$

Step 2: Apply the power rule to the right side of the equation.
$\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = (2^4)^{2x+5} \Rightarrow \left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = 2^{4(2x+5)}$

Step 3: Equate the exponents using the one-to-one property of exponents.
$\left(\frac{1}{4}\right)^{2x+8} = 2^{8x+20} \Rightarrow (2^{-2})^{2x+8} = 2^{8x+20}$
Divide both sides of the equation by -12: $\frac{-12x}{-12} = \frac{36}{-12}$
